usp.test_sphinx package¶

Submodules¶

usp.test_sphinx.useful_1 module¶

class usp.test_sphinx.useful_1.MyPublicClass(foo, bar=’baz’)[source]¶

Bases: object

We use this as a public class example class.

You never call this class before calling public_fn_with_sphinxy_docstring().

Note

An example of intersphinx is this: you cannot use pickle on this class.

get_foobar(foo, bar=True)[source]¶

This gets the foobar

This really should have a full function definition, but I am too lazy.

>>> print get_foobar(10, 20)
30
>>> print get_foobar('a', 'b')
ab

Isn’t that what you want?

usp.test_sphinx.useful_1.public_fn_with_googley_docstring(name, state=None)[source]¶

This function does something.

Args:
name (str): The name to use.
Kwargs:
state (bool): Current state to be in.
Returns:

int. The return code:

0 -- Success!
1 -- No good.
2 -- Try again.
Raises:
AttributeError, KeyError

A really great idea. A way you might use me is

>>> print public_fn_with_googley_docstring(name='foo', state=None)
0

BTW, this always returns 0. NEVER use with MyPublicClass.

  • state (bool.) – Current state to be in.
